definition: to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
to purchase (from various places)/to acquire (a company)
to procure (for an enterprise etc)/to purchase
to undertake to purchase sth/to subscribe (to share issue)
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)

sentences.english: None were cancelled or lapsed during the period.
sentences.chinese: 于期内，概无任何购股权遭注销或作废。

sentences.english: Most of our money goes on fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我们的大部分钱用于购时装。

sentences.english: When a large company gets bought out you wonder about your job.
sentences.chinese: 一家大公司被别人收买购，你自然担心你的饭碗。

sentences.english: For group discount, letter of introduction from your company is needed.
sentences.chinese: 购团体票凭单位介绍信或团体证明。

sentences.english: If you want to Chuk Yuen Estate to buy lychees, the villagers will take you to lychee Island.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想去竹园村购荔枝，村民就会带你来到荔枝岛。

sentences.english: In addition, some high-income residents have purchased airline tickets, ready to fly abroad.
sentences.chinese: 此外，一些高收入居民纷纷购飞机票，准备飞往国外。

sentences.english: If Ihad got enough money yesterday, I would have bought that tape.
sentences.chinese: 如因我今天钱够的话，我就购了那盒磁带了。

sentences.english: He payed his subscription by banker's order.
sentences.chinese: 他用银行本票支付购股金。

definition: to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
abbr. for 特別優惠|特别优惠[te4 bie2 you1 hui4]/ex gratia
advance sale/to sell in advance/to book
bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate
a fraudulent purchase/to buy up sth illegally
see 商城縣|商城县[Shang1 cheng2 xian4]
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin
group buying/collective buying/buying by a group of individuals who negotiate a discount for the group
